definition: abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory

sentences.english: But he tried a third time, was accepted and marched into the history books.
sentences.chinese: 但他做了第三次尝试，最终被录取并且名垂青史。

sentences.english: The number of ancestors patriots, fearless express feat legacy remain merit.
sentences.chinese: 多少先辈志士，无畏抒壮举，青史留功绩。

sentences.english: This Battle will be cherished and remembered forever.
He left a name in history as a national hero .
sentences.chinese: 他作为民族英雄而名垂青史。

sentences.english: She really has left her name in the history book.
sentences.chinese: 她真可以说是名留青史啊。

sentences.english: It is said that Herod took on such big projects because he wanted his name to be remembered forever.
sentences.chinese: 据说希律王是为了名留青史才接下这些巨大的工程。

sentences.english: How much blood and sweat dedication, but not French law of England.
sentences.chinese: 奉献几多血和汗，不求青史留英名。

sentences.english: And, for the great cause above history would have in turn also choose also.
sentences.chinese: 而青史之上，举大业者亦莫不有择于转折也。

sentences.english: That is how we will make the most of this extraordinary moment.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们将如何成就这昭彰青史的一刻。

sentences.english: But went down in the history as one of the greatest composers of all time.
sentences.chinese: 但是他作为最伟大的作曲家而留名青史。

sentences.english: At 70, Nazarbayev is eager for a place in history as the father of his country.
sentences.chinese: 70岁的纳扎尔巴耶夫期望作为国家之父而永垂青史。

sentences.english: Even if history goes up in ashe, my love never ever dies.
sentences.chinese: 纵然青史已经成灰，我爱不灭。

sentences.english: As Wenger stated, it left his Arsenal 'immortal'.
sentences.chinese: 温格表示，这会使他的这支阿森纳永垂青史。

sentences.english: Both Adams and Leverrier are honored for discovering Neptune.
sentences.chinese: 亚当斯和勒威耶两人都因发现了海王星而名垂青史。

definition: for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
lit. reputation will go down in history (idiom); fig. achievements will earn eternal glory
a good reputation to last a hundred generations
a good reputation to last down the generations
